intro: Orthosia ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian orthosia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
